intro: Derris canarensis, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, woody pods containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
